clinical_study.official_title: Jena Sepsis Registry - a Sepsis-registry for Long Term Outcomes

brief_summary.textblock: Despite the burden of severe sepsis and septic shock deficiencies in the quality of sepsis management are recognized. Investigators present a population-based registry with easy feasibility as part of German Center for Sepsis Control & Care (CSCC). All ICU patients of the Jena University Hospital, Germany will be screened for inclusion (severe sepsis or septic shock). Baseline data on ICU- and hospital care will be extracted from patient records at ICU discharge. The primary outcome is change in all-cause mortality from baseline to follow up at 6, 12, 24, 36, 48 and 60 months after diagnosis of sepsis. Follow-up data will be collected from the primary care provider of the patient. The registry may provide valid data on quality in sepsis care.

primary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to 6,12, 24, 36, 48 and 60 months after ICU discharge
primary_outcome.description: based on data from hospital records as well as patient records of the primary care provider.

clinical_study.condition: Severe Sepsis or Septic Shock (ICD-10-GM, R65.0, R65.1)

study_pop.textblock: patients will be selected from Jena University Hospital, Germany

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients treated in one of the ICUs will be enrolled if they were 18 years or older and fulfill the diagnostic criteria of severe sepsis or septic shock (ICD-10-GM, R65.0, R65.1) (19), (20).
- Diagnosis of severe sepsis or septic shock requires the following criteria: a microbiologically documented and/or clinically evident infection, at least two of the four criteria of the systemic inflammatory response syndrome (SIRS) and at least one new organ dysfunction, remote from the site of infection.
